intro: Streptanthus diversifolius, commonly known as the variable-leaf whitlow grass, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in late spring. Its leaves are varied in shape, which gives it its scientific name, and it has a distinctive, compact growth form. Streptanthus diversifolius is often found in coastal and inland areas with well-drained soils.
